resources.string: Precipitation is the fall of water in either liquid or frozen form from the atmosphere to the earth\'s surface
Wind speed is a unit that measures the speed of air flow from high pressure to low pressure.

The UV index is a number without units to explain the level of exposure to ultraviolet radiation that is related to human health. 

UV Index 0-2 = Low (low danger) 
UV Index 3-5 = moderate (medium danger) 
UV Index 6-7 = High (high danger) 
UV Index 8-10 = Very High (very high danger) 
UV Index >11 = Extreme (very dangerous)
Humidity is the level of air wetness (the amount of water contained in the air) expressed as a percentage relative to the saturation point.
